page.title: 09Wentworth, an Estate Village
page.content: {Wentworth}is an{estate village.}All the doors and window frames are painted{green and cream}and these are the{Wentworth family colours.}All the people who live in the village are tenants and{not}owners. There are very few new houses in Wentworth because the Estate has{strict}rules about any new building. People who live there even had to ask{permission}if they wanted to build a garage. The only new building that has been done are the {old peoples bungalows.}The{oldest {building}in the village is probably {Sue Hunts shop.}Along Main Street some of the cottages are lower than the road this is because the road was built after the cottages. In{1979}Earl Fitzwilliam transfered the village to a{charitable trust}to keep it just as it is. The villagers{dont}want Wentworth to change at all.
